intro: Eurycentrum obscurum, commonly known as the dark-centred spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Eurycentrum obscurum is often found in swampy or wetland habitats, where it thrives in the humid, shaded conditions.
